alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 15 at 3:01AM MST until January 15 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 6 PM MST TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS...MARGINALLY LOW HUMIDITY...AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... .A potent Pacific storm system will enter New Mexico today bringing widespread strong winds to eastern NM. The combination of strong winds, above normal temperatures and marginally low humidity will elevate the potential for wildfire growth across eastern NM. Winds will slowly taper off this evening while cooler temperatures and higher humidities move into the area. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains and East Central Plains from 10 am to 6 pm MST today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 18 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
